title: Solving a 700-Year-Old Royal Murder Mystery
summary: Scientists have used new tools to solve a very old mystery about a duke who was killed long ago. Duke Béla of Macsó was a young nobleman who lived 700 years ago. He had family roots from Scandinavia and the Rurik dynasty. In 1272, he was attacked and killed in a planned and emotional way. Researchers studied his bones and other clues to find out how he died and who he was. This discovery helps us learn more about history and how science can answer big questions from the past. It shows that even after many years, we can uncover secrets using genetics and forensics.

background_read: This article is about using science to solve a historical mystery. Duke Béla was a nobleman from long ago, and scientists used DNA and other tests on his bones to find out about his life and death. This helps us understand how people lived and died in the past, and how science can uncover secrets that were hidden for centuries.
